passages.text: August 29, 2025 11:11 AM GMT
Sanrio (8136) | Japan
Raise PT on Higher Estimates Reflecting Favorable Conditions in China/Japan
Sanrio (8136.T)FromToPrice Target¥7,400¥7,900
We expect a stable profit growth phase medium term. Raise PT to ¥7,900 but stay EW as current share price looks reasonable.
- Raise PT from ¥7,400 to ¥7,900, based on higher F3/26-28 ests mainly for Asia, Japan & Europe that offset cuts for Americas (varying conditions by region)
- We reduce our Americas estimate mainly to factor in US tariff impacts (incl. lower sales volume due to higher retail prices)
- Why we hike for other regions: Asia (mainly China): growth in character goods market; Japan: rising inbound demand; Europe: the firm's multi-character strategy
- Sanrio's business conditions remain positive, incl. growing global demand for Japan character goods + ongoing growth in popularity of Sanrio characters globally

Revisions in our earnings estimates: We raise our OP estimates to ¥68.3bn in F3/26 (+31.8% YoY; +¥4.6bn vs prior estimate; +0.2% vs consensus), ¥78.8bn in F3/27 (+15.4%; +¥5.6bn; -0.7%), and ¥86.3bn in F3/28 (+9.5%; +¥6.7bn; -2.9%).
Exhibit 1: Our revised estimates
Exhibit 2: Sanrio earnings and share price trends
Source: QUICK, Company data, Morgan Stanley Research; e-Morgan Stanley Research sets,
Exhibit 3: Background to expansion of demand for Japanese characters globally
Exhibit 4: Quarterly earnings
Source: Company data, Morgan Stanley Research; e= Morgan Stanley Research ests
Exhibit 6: Income statement
Source: Company data, Morgan Stanley Research; e= Morgan Stanley Research ests

Source: Company data, Morgan Stanley Research; e= Morgan Stanley Research ests

Expect profit growth on rising global character demand, but looks fairly valued
Key: Historical Stock Performance Current Stock Price Price Target
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research

1) Character planning/sales major with roster of around 450 characters (incl. Hello Kitty, Cinnamoroll). 2) Expecting stable OP growth on rising brand recognition via growing worldwide demand for characters. 3) Support for global character demand from expanding adult fan culture, with Japanese characters becoming popular worldwide, and women playing a larger role in the popularity of certain characters. 4) Watching medium-term plan scheduled for announcement May 2025 (OP of at least ¥40bn by F3/27) and long-term targets (market cap of ¥1trn; OP of at least ¥50bn).
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research

High OP growth above base case thanks to further growth in worldwide demand for characters, earnings boost from greater competitiveness, and monetization of education, games, and other new businesses. To emphasize medium-term earnings prospects, our bull case fair value of ¥13,000 is based on our F3/28e EPS of ¥427.3 and P/E of 30.5x obtained through regression analysis of 10-year historical share prices and EPS estimates.

Double-digit OP growth on growing demand worldwide for characters, broader brand recognition. In recognition of medium- term earnings prospects, our base case PT of ¥7,900 is based on our F3/28e EPS of ¥260.4 and P/E of 30.5x obtained through regression analysis of 10- year historical share prices and EPS estimates).

OP growth slows due to stalling growth in worldwide demand for characters, stiffer sales competition, dropout of boosts from restructuring, and delays in monetizing education/games and other new businesses. In focusing on medium- term earnings prospects, our bear case fair value of ¥3,700 is based on our F3/28e EPS of ¥120.5 and P/E of 30.5x obtained through regression analysis of 10- year historical share prices and EPS estimates.

Rising OP growth prospects on enhanced competitiveness, higher OPM via curb on advertising spend, sales growth as Sanrio characters gain popularity worldwide, monetization of education business and games with development of new services
Source: Morgan Stanley Research Estimate View explanation of regional hierarchies here
4/5 3 Month MOST Horizon
Source: Refinitiv, FactSet, Morgan Stanley Research; 1 is the highest favored Quintile and 5 is the least favored Quintile

Increase in OP growth prospects thanks to greater competitiveness Steady creation of hit characters as development capabilities strengthen Increase in sales as Sanrio characters gain popularity worldwide
Fall in OP growth prospects due to stiffer sales competition from rivals Lack of hit characters as development capabilities weaken Sluggish sales as Sanrio characters fall in popularity worldwide
Inst. Owners, % Active Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research
Mean Morgan Stanley Estimates Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research

Within the last 12 months, Morgan Stanley has received compensation for investment banking services from Anycolor, COVER, Sanrio, Toei.

In the next 3 months, Morgan Stanley expects to receive or intends to seek compensation for investment banking services from Aeon Fantasy, Anycolor, COVER, Round One, Sanrio, Toei, Toei Animation, Toho.

Within the last 12 months, Morgan Stanley has provided or is providing investment banking services to, or has an investment banking client relationship with, the following company: Anycolor, Sanrio, Toei, Toei Animation, Toho.

Within the last 12 months, Morgan Stanley has either provided or is providing non- investment banking, securities- related services to and/or in the past has entered into an agreement to provide services or has a client relationship with the following company: Sanrio.

Morgan Stanley uses a relative rating system using terms such as Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated or Underweight (see definitions below). Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold and sell. Investors should carefully read the definitions of all ratings used in Morgan Stanley Research. In addition, since Morgan Stanley Research contains more complete information concerning the analyst's views, investors should carefully read Morgan Stanley Research, in its entirety, and not infer the contents from the rating alone. In any case, ratings (or research) should not be used or relied upon as investment advice. An investor's decision to buy or sell a stock should depend on individual circumstances (such as the investor's existing holdings) and other considerations.
(as of July 31, 2025)

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm. For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Data include common stock and ADRs currently assigned ratings. Investment Banking Clients are companies from whom Morgan Stanley received investment banking compensation in the last 12 months. Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub-regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.

values.category: Change in consumer culture: Generalization and
sub_categories: Expanding the spread of kawaii culture (Mainly women - generalization)
Expanding the spread of adult otaku culture (Mainly men - generalization)
Expanding the spread of fan activity (Mainly women - generalization)

values.category: Changes in user usage environment: Increased
sub_categories: Expanding use of PCs, smartphones and game consoles

values.category: Changes in consumer behavior triggered by the Covid pandemic
sub_categories: Covid infection spread - Sedation and normalization of life
Growing demand for home entertainment - Rounding
Increased contact with Japanese entertainment - Attractiveness recognition - rate of use

values: World entertainment and users (Core user - bitten, Japan-users - global users)
Increase in new (Core user - bitten, Japanese fans - global fans)
Increased demand for products and services

values: Expanding the global Japanese entertainment market (Character, Animation, Game, Comics)
Expanding the global Japanese character market
